SEARCH
Package main.java.com.mms.board

Class Board

java.lang.Object
main.java.com.mms.board.Board
public class Board extends Object
Represents a Sudoku board, managing the generation, modification, and manipulation of the game grid.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    private static class 
    Board.Field
    Represents a single cell in a Sudoku board, storing its value and possible values.

  • Field Details

    • size

      private int size
      Determines the number of rows/columns in a single subgrid.

    • fullSize

      private int fullSize
      Represents the full size of the Sudoku board (size * size).

    • board

      private Board.Field[][] board
      Represents the Sudoku board as a two-dimensional array of Field objects. Each Field object corresponds to a cell on the Sudoku board.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(int size)
      Constructs a Sudoku board with the given size.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the Sudoku grid (number of rows/columns in a subgrid).

  • Method Details

    • setSize

      public void setSize(int size)
      Sets the size of the sudoku grid.
      Parameters:
      size - The size to be set for the Sudoku grid (number of rows/columns in a subgrid).

    • getValue

      public int getValue(int y, int x)
      Retrieves the value at the specified coordinates (x, y) on the Sudoku board.
      Parameters:
      y - The y-coordinate representing the column index.
      x - The x-coordinate representing the row index.
      Returns:
      The numerical value present at the given coordinates on the Sudoku board.

    • generateEmptyBoard

      private void generateEmptyBoard()
      Generates an empty Sudoku board with all cells initialized to zero. Creates a 2D array of Field objects representing the Sudoku board and sets each cell's value to zero.

    • generateBoard

      public void generateBoard()
      Generates a Sudoku board by filling it with values according to Sudoku rules. Uses a randomized approach to populate the board with valid values. It repeatedly attempts to fill the board with values while ensuring validity. If successful, the method stops; otherwise, it continues until a valid solution is found.

    • generatePuzzle

      public void generatePuzzle(double difficulty)
      Generates a puzzle of the specified difficulty by removing fields from the board.
      Parameters:
      difficulty - The difficulty level of the puzzle, a double value ranging from 0 to 1. 0 indicates easier puzzles, while 1 represents more challenging ones.

    • copyBoard

      private Board.Field[][] copyBoard(Board.Field[][] array)
      Creates a deep copy of a 2D array of Field objects.
      Parameters:
      array - The original 2D array of Field objects to be copied.
      Returns:
      A new 2D array containing copies of the Field objects from the original array.

    • to1DArray

      private Board.Field[] to1DArray(Board.Field[][] array)
      Converts a 2D array of Field objects representing the Sudoku board to a 1D array.
      Parameters:
      array - A 2D array of Field objects representing the Sudoku board.
      Returns:
      A 1D array containing all Field objects from the 2D array in a linear sequence.

    • indexToCoordinates

      private int[] indexToCoordinates(int index)
      Converts a linear index to 2D coordinates representing a cell's position on the Sudoku board.
      Parameters:
      index - The linear index representing the position of a cell in the 1D representation of the board.
      Returns:
      An array of two integers representing the row and column coordinates of the cell on the board.

    • updatePossibleValues

      private void updatePossibleValues(Board.Field[][] board)
      Updates the possible values for each cell on the Sudoku board based on current cell values and constraints.
      Parameters:
      board - a 2D array representing the Sudoku board with fields containing values

    • RemoveArrayElement

      private int[] RemoveArrayElement(int[] array, int number)
      Removes a specified element from an integer array and returns a new array without that element.
      Parameters:
      array - The input integer array from which the element needs to be removed.
      number - The element to be removed from the array.
      Returns:
      An updated array without the specified element. If the element doesn't exist, the original array is returned.
